trend_summary: Forest cover gradually fragments as rectangular cropland blocks proliferate, mainly in the east-central sector. A few new farmsteads, silos and minor road widenings appear, but settlements stay dispersed. No major industrial or residential clusters develop; human pressure is limited to agricultural intensification, keeping the landscape fundamentally rural and sparsely built.
notable_changes: Progressive clearing of mixed woodland, especially along central ridges and eastern slopes.
Expansion and consolidation of light-colored cropland plots, forming larger continuous fields.
Emergence of several small building clusters/farmsteads connected by newly paved access roads.
Slight straightening and resurfacing of a north-south arterial road, improving connectivity.
Patchy reforestation or regrowth visible in isolated western parcels after earlier cuts.
